data.title: History of Council Members
data.text:
Chief Legislative Bodies of Knoxville Through the Years:

2022-2023 - City Council (9)

Ms. Lynne Fugate - At Large Seat A

Ms. Gwen McKenzie - 6th District *

Ms. Amelia Parker - At Large Seat C *

Ms. Lauren Rider - 4th District

Andrew Roberto - Vice Mayor 2nd District

Ms. Seema Singh - 3rd District

Tommy Smith - 1st District

Ms. Janet Testerman - At Large Seat B

Charles Thomas - 5th District

2020-2021 - City Council (9)

Ms. Lynne Fugate - At Large Seat A

Ms. Gwen McKenzie - Vice Mayor - 6th District (first African-American female to serve as Vice Mayor) *

Ms. Amelia Parker - At Large Seat C *

Ms. Lauren Rider - 4th District

Andrew Roberto - 2nd District

Ms. Seema Singh - 3rd District

Tommy Smith - 1st District (appointed to fill remainder of Welch's term)

Ms. Janet Testerman - At Large Seat B

Charles Thomas - 5th District

Ms. Stephanie Welch - 1st District (resigned Feb. 16, 2020 to become the City's Chief Economic & Community Development Officer and Deputy to the Mayor)

2011 - City Council (9)

Joe Bailey, Vice Mayor - At Large Seat A

Bob Becker - 5th District (resigned Jan. 11, 2011 to move to Virginia)*

Charles Thomas - 5th District (appointed to fill remainder of Becker's term)

Daniel T. Brown - 6th District (served also as Interim Mayor Jan. 10-Dec. 17, 2011 - On Jan. 10, 2011, Mayor Bill Haslam resigned as Mayor to become Governor of the State of Tennessee. Immediately after Haslam's resignation, a special called City Council meeting was held and Vice Mayor Bob Becker was presiding officer of the meeting. After a 12 round vote, Councilman Daniel Brown was chosen unanimously by City Council members to become Interim Mayor and he served from that day through Dec. 17, 2011. ) *

1797-1801 - Commissioners

Unknown - Prior to 1797, the commissioners of the City of Knoxville were appointed by the Governor of Tennessee. Subsequent to the 1794 term, the state legislature authorized the city to elect commissioners; however, there is no record of such action on the part of the city until the election for commission terms commencing in 1802.

1794-1796 - Commissioners

John Chisholm

Samuel Cowan

Joseph Greer

John King

George Roulstone

1791-1793 Commissioners

John Adair

Paul Cunningham

George McNutt

* Denotes African-American member. Per Knoxville historian and former City Councilman, Robert J. Booker, there was a 57 year absence of African-American representation on City Council from 1912 to 1969.
